noun.description: In parts of south and south-east Asia, especially Siam (now Thailand): a long and richly decorated state barge propelled by oars.

origin: Mid 17th century; earliest use found in Henry Cogan (fl. 1652–1653). Originally from Portuguese balão, † ballaam; in later use partly reborrowed from French balon, † ballon long, oared boat of south-east Asia.
